_header: Hail be Thou Queen of great honour
_description: On the Seven Joys of the Virgin Mary in Heaven — eleven quatrains, preceded by a version in prose

BLRoy17Axvi.First Lines:
[H]ayll be þu qwen of gret honoureOur lord þi hert has
                    fild with grace…
BLRoy17Axvi.Last Lines:
…So þat we may in paradiesWith þe and her duell
                    endlesly
BLRoy17Axvi.Note:
Space left for enlarged initial ‘H’, which was left
                    blank.
BLRoy17Axvi.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 57-8.
